title: Print, "First plate from the set of twelve projects for engraved silver cups (12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg)", 1580
medium: Punch engraving, pen and black ink on off-white laid paper
markings:
Watermark: bear with collar and hanging tongue (horizontal)
verso: Fürstlich Waldburg-Wolfegg´schen Kupferstichkabinett [Lugt 2542]
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper right corner in pen and black ink: 143; in escutcheon: 12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg.
dimensions:
Sheet: 29.5 x 18.8 cm (11 5/8 x 7 3/8 in.)
Platemark: 15.2 x 10.8 cm (6 x 4 1/4 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: On a simple vase-like form, elaborate strap-work contains fruit and flowers above an escutcheon containing the title of the set.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "First plate from the set of twelve projects for engraved silver cups (12 Stick Zvm Ver Zaichnen Stechen ver Fertigt Bernhartzan Goldschmid Gesel Inn Niernberg)", 1580.
1580. Punch engraving, pen and black ink on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1942-36-8.
